business.headline: Are millennials and Gen Z behind 90–95% of India's home purchases?For many borrowers under 40, applying for a home loan online is no longer optional, it is the preferred way. Around 72% of borrowers in this age group choose digital applications, and nearly half of borrowers above 60 are also getting comfortable with online processes.

Cochin Shipyard, HAL, BEL: Are defence stocks set for a strong comeback?The defence theme is back on screens. Now it needs breadth, sustained volumes and follow-through to turn early strength into a lasting rally.

Adani Group announces $100 billion to build AI-ready, green data centres by 2035The $100 billion direct investment is expected to catalyse an additional $150 billion across related sectors over the next decade. These include server manufacturing, advanced electrical infrastructure, sovereign cloud platforms, and semiconductor and compute ecosystems.

Star Health rejects Lucknow man's viral allegation over mother's claim rejectionIn a post, the man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year as premium for his mother's health insurance policy. When she fell ill, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance to seek claim support.

Gold drops over Rs 2,500, silver falls Rs 6,000: Are bigger price cuts on the way?Gold and silver have taken a sharp hit, shaking confidence after weeks of strong gains. As volatility rises, investors are trying to understand whether this decline signals a larger trend shift.

Changed your salary account? Here's what happens to your PF withdrawals nowUpdating your account when there is no urgency is far easier than scrambling to fix it when you need funds quickly. Think of it as preventive maintenance for your finances.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech gain up to 3%: Why are IT stocks rising today?The main trigger for the rally was Infosys announcing a strategic partnership with artificial intelligence firm Anthropic. Investors reacted positively to the news, pushing Infosys shares nearly 3% higher to around Rs 1,407 during the session.

Infosys shares jump 3% today after announcing partnership with AnthropicThis new partnership will help companies in tough, rule-heavy sectors use AI better, and improve efficiency in providing essential services to the public.
Sensex, Nifty open lower but IT stocks rallyThe S&P BSE added 42.49 points to 83,319.64, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.05 points to 25,665.70 as of 10:10 am.

Global tech giants see billions erased amid rising AI cost concernsInvestors who once rewarded bold AI plans are now asking tougher questions about spending, profits and competition. Several of the largest US technology firms have lost hundreds of billions of dollars in market value since the start of 2026.

India–US trade deal advances with focus on finalising legal agreementSpeaking on the development, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said a joint statement outlining the contours of the agreement has already been signed. He said that these contours now need to be converted into a formal legal agreement.

Record MSP procurement: How many farmers are actually benefiting?India's MSP system is clearly expanding, with higher spending, larger procurement and more beneficiaries than before. Yet the debate has shifted from scale to security.
Sensex rallies over 600 points: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 650.39 points to close at 83,277.15, while the NSE Nifty50 added 211.65 points to end at 25,682.75.

How cash levels in mutual funds impact returns during volatile marketsIn the current market, volatility caused by global and external factors has led some mutual funds to increase their cash positions. The idea is to lower risk and protect portfolios from sudden corrections.

Can NPS help you save tax in the new regime? What salaried employees must knowFor salaried workers who have moved to the new tax regime, tax saving can feel limited. This has led many to question if there are still practical ways to ease their tax burden. Let's have a look.

Can your employer refuse gratuity if you get pension? Here's what employees must knowMany employees assume that receiving a pension from their employer means they may have to give up gratuity. But the law draws a clear distinction between the two. A recent court ruling has clarified what workers should know about their rights.

Why Mumbai remains India's top luxury housing hubThe global recognition Mumbai is receiving today is best understood as validation rather than arrival. International research now ranks the city among the world's fastest-growing luxury housing markets, reflecting sustained price appreciation at the very top end.

Using old tax regime? Here's how draft income tax rules 2026 could help you save moreIf you are still using the old income tax regime, the government's draft rules for 2026 may bring some welcome relief. Proposed changes to key exemptions and allowances could slightly lower your tax bill and make the traditional regime more rewarding.

RBI move hits Dalal Street stocks: BSE, Groww fall up to 10%. Here's whyThe selling pressure came after the RBI issued a revised circular on February 13 under its amended RBI (Commercial Banks – Credit Facilities) Directions. The new rules change how banks can lend to entities involved in the capital markets.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as market sentiment remain cautious over IT selloffThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 47.79 points to 82,578.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.45 points to 25,464.75 as of 9:48 am.

entertainment.headline: The Night Manager is 3: Anil Kapoor reveals the scene that reflects his early life Actor Anil Kapoor marked the third anniversary of The Night Manager by sharing how a pivotal scene resonated with his personal journey. The series also featured Aditya Roy Kapur and Sobhita Dhulipala.

Women in Cinema Collective to honour 2017 assault survivor with candlelight vigil The Women in Cinema Collective (WCC) has called for Avalkoppam candlelight gatherings across Kerala on February 17, marking the anniversary of the 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Brilliant without flamboyance: Anupam Kher honours Robert Duvall Veteran actor Anupam Kher has expressed deep admiration for Hollywood legend Robert Duvall. He shared a heartfelt tribute that highlighted Duvall's understated yet impactful approach to acting.

Neena Gupta calls out deep-rooted patriarchy in India: Things have not changed Neena Gupta has questioned claims of social progress in India, saying patriarchy continues to shape women's lives within households. Citing personal examples, she stressed that deep-rooted expectations around marriage and virginity still persist.

Salim Khan, actor Salman Khan's father, hospitalised in Mumbai Veteran screenwriter Salim Khan, father of superstar Salman Khan, was hospitalised in Mumbai on Tuesday. More details on his health are awaited.

Rakhi Sawant dragged out of Bigg Boss Marathi 6? Promo suggests so Rakhi Sawant appears to be in hot water on Bigg Boss Marathi Season 6 as a promo shows her being dragged out of the house following a dramatic outburst.

Priyanka Chopra credits Aishwarya Rai, Irrfan Khan for paving her Hollywood path Priyanka Chopra, speaking at the Harvard India Conference, credited Aishwarya Rai, Irrfan Khan and Mindy Kaling for paving the way in Hollywood. She also shared an emotional note on representation and her journey on Instagram.

Regena Cassandrra says she faced derogatory treatment in Bollywood Regena Cassandrra opened up about facing derogatory treatment in Bollywood due to her South Indian roots. Despite her strong command of Hindi, the actor revealed she was often put down, leading her to prioritise versatile roles to avoid being stereotyped.

Anushka-Virat meet Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan after son Akaay's birthday Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli met Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan on February 16. A picture of the couple attending a special 'keertan' has emerged online.

Pocket Novel: It's Vijay Sethupathi vs Raj B Shetty for Thiagarajan Kumararaja film Filmmaker Thiagarajan Kumararaja has announced his next project, marking his return to direction after seven years, with Vijay Sethupathi in the lead and Raj B Shetty featuring as the antagonist.

John Abraham on working with male co-stars: We complement, not compete John Abraham says he believes in complementing, not competing with his male co-stars, sharing that he feels most comfortable working alongside them.

The Kerala Story 2 trailer: Sequel promises same explosive plot in various states The trailer for The Kerala Story 2 - Goes Beyond delves into sensitive issues of religious conversion, featuring stories from Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Kerala. The film is set for release on February 27, 2026.

Mohit Raina, Priya Mani to lead Indo-Hollywood film on immigrant family's true story Mohit Raina and Priya Mani will headline a new Indo-Hollywood film based on a true immigrant family story. The project marks a key collaboration aiming to explore identity and belonging beyond borders.

BMC blacklists Aditya Dhar's production house over Dhurandhar: The Revenge shoot The BMC has blacklisted Aditya Dhar's B62 Productions over alleged on-set violations during the shoot of Dhurandhar: The Revenge in Mumbai. The civic body also imposed a Rs 1 lakh penalty and forfeited a Rs 25,000 security deposit.

Seyon teaser: Sivakarthikeyan channels Lord Virumandi in Kamal Haasan film On Sivakarthikeyan's birthday, the first glimpse of Seyon was unveiled, presenting his character as a figure channelling Lord Virumandi in Sivakumar Murugesan's upcoming film.

Allu Arjun's 42-rule report: Strategist who made claim now 'sincerely' regrets Brand strategist Kaveri Baruah has issued a public apology after her claims regarding Allu Arjun's meeting protocols. This came after Baruah faced backlash over her remarks, which the actor's team denied.

Israeli producer Dana Eden, co-creator of Tehran, found dead in Athens Israeli producer Dana Eden, co-creator of Emmy-winning Tehran, died suddenly in Athens. Her death raises questions amid ongoing filming of the show's fourth season.

Rajpal Yadav's brother Chandrapal hopes for acche din as actor walks out of jail Rajpal Yadav's brother, Chandrapal, spoke to the media about his brother's bail. He said the family is hoping to see better days in the near future after the actor was granted interim bail by the Delhi High Court until March 18 in a cheque bounce case.

Ajith Kumar's fans can now ride in his race car in Dubai. Here's how Actor Ajith Kumar drove his fans in his Ferrari 488 at Dubai Autodrome. The actor has taken a break from his films to take part in racing championships.

general news.headline: Minister apologises for AI Summit Day 1 issues, promises smoother experienceUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw apologised for the issues witnessed on the opening day of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, calling the turnout "phenomenal". He said the government is committed to addressing concerns to ensure a smoother experience for attendees.

Video shows SUV ramming Delhi biker head-on, mother says teen was filming reelsThe mother of a 23-year-old man who died in a road accident last week has released a video, claiming it captures the exact moment an SUV, driven by a 17-year-old, hit her son.

Fierce face-off amid Bangladesh oath-taking, Jamaat bloc threatens street protestsStreet agitation like it was seen against the Sheikh Hasina regime could return to Bangladesh over the July Charter. On the day of the swearing-in of the Tarique Rahman-led government, the Jamaat and the NCP have warned of street protests, calling the BNP a "fascist" force.

Live: President Macron, First Lady Brigitte pay tribute to 26/11 victims in MumbaiPM Modi-Macron Mumbai Meeting Live Updates: French President Emmanuel Macron arrived in Mumbai on Monday night along with First Lady Brigitte Macron on a three-day official visit (February 17-19) to India, during which Artificial Intelligence (AI) and strategic cooperation are expected to feature prominently in talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. This is Macron's fourth official visit to India, and through his post on X, he acknowledged that this visit would strengthen the strategic co-operation between India and France. The French President on Tuesday paid homage to the victims of 26/11. Catch all the live updates in indiatoday.in

NGT clears path for India's Hong Kong. What's the Great Nicobar Project?The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has refused to interfere with the environmental clearance for the Rs 81,000-crore Great Nicobar Project. This effectively removes a major legal hurdle and allows the mega strategic plan to move forward. Here's what you need to know about India's most ambitious island infrastructure push that aims to challenge Chinese assertion in the Indo-Pacific.

Treat Imran Khan fairly: Kapil, Gavaskar join 14 captains in appeal to Pak govtFormer India captains Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar have joined a rare global cricketing appeal seeking better treatment for Imran Khan, the former Pakistan Prime Minister and 1992 World Cup-winning captain, who remains in jail amid growing health concerns.

Rashmika-Vijay want no phones at wedding, plan month's break after ceremonyActors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda will marry in a private ceremony in Udaipur on February 26. The couple has implemented a no-phone policy to avoid leaks.

Live: Conceptual clarity in CBSE Class 10 Maths paper in Section AThe CBSE Board Exams 2026 have officially commenced today for Class 10 and Class 12, with more than 43 lakh students appearing across examination centres nationwide. Exams are being held in a single shift from 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, so timely arrival at centres is crucial. Get complete exam day guidelines, last-minute preparation tips, dress code rules, and all essential updates to ensure a smooth and stress-free exam experience. Stay tuned for the latest news and live updates from the CBSE Board Exams 2026.

Why US envoy's rare Army command visit near Pakistan border sparked buzzA routine visit by the US envoy and the US Indo-Pacific commander to the Indian Army's Western Command near the Pakistan border has generated considerable buzz. This is the first such high-profile visit after Operation Sindoor. But, behind the optics, lies a broader message.

Live: NCP MPs to boycott Tarique Rahman swearing-inTarique Rahman Oath Ceremony live updates: The BNP government led by Tarique Rahman is expected to take oath shortly. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has landed in Dhaka to take part in the swearing-in. Newly elected MPs of the BNP and the Jamaat alliance took oath earlier on Tuesday.

BMC blacklists Aditya Dhar's production house over Dhurandhar: The Revenge shootThe BMC has blacklisted Aditya Dhar's B62 Productions over alleged on-set violations during the shoot of Dhurandhar: The Revenge in Mumbai. The civic body also imposed a Rs 1 lakh penalty and forfeited a Rs 25,000 security deposit.

Kalli Purie pitches 9-point charter for fair AI use in media at AI Impact SummitSpeaking at the India AI Impact Summit, Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief of the India Today Group, noted that use of AI in media should be based on fairness, accountability and reciprocity.

Sarvam teases new AI smartglasses at India AI Impact Summit, PM Modi gives it a tryIndian AI startup Sarvam AI has announced its first-ever AI smartglasses during the India AI Impact Summit. Sarvam AI chief Pratyush Kumar also revealed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has tried this device already.

Bengaluru couple 'forgets' their sleeping child in cab, rescued in an hourThe couple immediately contacted the local police through the emergency helpline and narrated the incident. The police took swift action and ensured the safe return of the kid.

Salim Khan, actor Salman Khan's father, hospitalised in MumbaiVeteran screenwriter Salim Khan, father of superstar Salman Khan, was hospitalised in Mumbai on Tuesday. More details on his health are awaited.

Adani Group announces $100 billion to build AI-ready, green data centres by 2035The $100 billion direct investment is expected to catalyse an additional $150 billion across related sectors over the next decade. These include server manufacturing, advanced electrical infrastructure, sovereign cloud platforms, and semiconductor and compute ecosystems.
Antarctica is sitting on a huge gravity hole. Is that why it's frozen?The research suggests that changes in Earth's interior may have influenced Antarctica's climate history.

Dear CBSE, the only 'improvement' needed is in your policy clarityBoard exams have begun, but the real confusion this year lies not in the question papers, it lies in CBSE's own rulebook. In the name of flexibility, a maze of categories, attempts, and circulars has left students and parents decoding policy instead of focusing on exams. Read this to understand how a reform has ended up complicating the system for an entire batch.

Bill Gates attending India AI Summit: Spokesperson counters Delhi event no-show buzzBill Gates will attend the India AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi and deliver his keynote as scheduled, a Gates Foundation spokesperson confirmed, dismissing speculations that he was skipping the event.

PM Modi-Macron Mumbai bilateral today, key defence deals in focusPrime Minister Narendra Modi welcomes French President Emmanuel Macron to India. Artificial intelligence and broader strategic cooperation are expected to dominate discussions with Modi, along with a renewed push for defence collaboration, including joint manufacturing of helicopters and HAMMER precision-guided missiles.

Humanoid robots perform Kung Fu at China's Spring Festival GalaChina's Spring Festival Gala in Beijing featured humanoid robots performing live Kung Fu to showcase the nation's rapid advances in robotics and AI.

Yunus needles India again with Seven Sisters remark in exit speechUnder Muhammad Yunus, Delhi-Dhaka ties reached their lowest ebb amid a rise in anti-India sentiment. In his farewell speech, Yunus again provoked India by referring to the Seven Sisters while asserting that Bangladesh was no longer a 'submissive' nation. What does his speech imply?

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 25 | Agitation Alchemy: Anna's Protests, Politics & Power PlaysTamil Nadu is the graveyard of national political parties. It buried the Congress at its peak then in 1967. The BJP, also at its peak now, has been pregnant with possibilities but has failed to deliver. Never a serious player in the state before the dawn of the Modi-era, the BJP has been humbled in every election since his arrival in 2014 (2019, 2021 and 2024).

Delhi biker was speeding: Teen SUV driver's brother on crashIn his account to India Today, the accused's brother alleged that the victim's bike emerged from behind a bus at high speed. He maintained that the teen did not flee but helped the injured, countering the victim's mother's claim that her son was left unattended for two hours.

sports.headline: Lone female on grid,  F1 aspirant Atiqa Mir climbs higher on WSK ladder Indian racing prodigy Atiqa has shown skill and maturity beyond her years after making a voluntary switch from the Mini to the far more demanding Junior category, producing standout performances in the early part of her 2026 international karting season.

IRE vs ZIM Live: Zimbabwe hunt Super 8s spot, toss delayed due to rain Ireland (IRE) vs Zimbabwe (ZIM) Live score, T20 World Cup: Zimbabwe are on the brink of causing a huge upset in the T20 World Cup. If Zimbabwe beat Ireland in this game, they will knock out Australia from the T20 World Cup 2026. At the moment, the toss is delayed due to rain.

New Zealand storm into Super 8s, knock Afghanistan out of T20 World Cup T20 World Cup: New Zealand stormed into the Super 8s with an eight-wicket win over Canada in Chennai. Glen Phillips and Rachin Ravindra's chase ended Afghanistan's campaign despite Yuvraj Samra's record-breaking century.

Pratika Rawal added to ODI squad for Australia tour after long injury lay off Star batter Pratika Rawal has been added to India's ODI squad after recovering from an ankle injury. India are set to take on Australia in a three-match ODI series beginning on February 24.

Treat Imran Khan fairly: Kapil, Gavaskar join 14 captains in appeal to Pak govt Former India captains Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar have joined a rare global cricketing appeal seeking better treatment for Imran Khan, the former Pakistan Prime Minister and 1992 World Cup-winning captain, who remains in jail amid growing health concerns.

FIH Pro League: Hardik Singh to lead India in Hobart leg; Harmanpreet ruled out Midfielder Hardik Singh was named captain of the embattled Indian men's hockey team for its FIH Pro League matches in Hobart from February 20 to 25 after regular skipper Harmanpreet Singh opted out due to "personal reasons."

Canada's Yuvraj Samra becomes youngest centurion in T20 World Cup history Canada opener Yuvraj Samra became the youngest centurion in men's T20 World Cup history during Canada's clash against New Zealand at the M. A. Chidambaram Stadium.

Shami scalps 8 wickets in Ranji semis, puts India selectors on high alert Mohammed Shami put India selectors on alert with an eight-wicket haul for Bengal in the Ranji Trophy semi-final against Jammu & Kashmir. The veteran pacer now has 38 wickets this season.

Ian Healy slams Australia's selection calls after defeat vs Sri Lanka Former Australia wicketkeeper Ian Healy has strongly criticised the team's selection after a heavy defeat to Sri Lanka. Australia now face an uphill battle to qualify for the Super 8 with their final group match against Oman.

Gambhir to join Rajasthan Royals? IPL franchise approach India coach Rajasthan Royals have approached India head coach Gautam Gambhir for a senior role in their setup amid an ownership change. However, Gambhir is unlikely to accept due to conflict-of-interest rules and national commitments.

Abhishek Sharma, just take a single first: Gavaskar's advice to India openerT20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar offered simple advice to Abhishek Sharma amid his tough start to the T20 World Cup. The former captain urged him to get off the mark first before unleashing his attacking game.

Did Pakistan players wait to shake hands with India after Colombo defeat?India defeated Pakistan by 61 runs in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 fixture. The Men in Blue maintained their no handshake policy against the arch-rivals.

Shoaib Akhtar's rapid U-turn: Mohsin Naqvi incompetent to good man in 24 hoursT20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar made a quick U-turn on his criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi after Pakistan's humiliating loss to India. Akhtar said his "incompetent" remark was twisted and Naqvi is "a good guy."

Smriti Mandhana named Indian sportswoman of the yearSmriti Mandhana was named BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year after a standout 2025 season. The opener starred in India's Women's World Cup triumph and also won another WPL title with RCB.

Jose Mourinho's Benfica not banking on miracles against a wounded Real MadridJose Mourinho says Real Madrid are a wounded king ahead of their Champions League clash with Benfica and insists his side need near perfection, not a miracle, to advance.

How Sri Lanka learned from Australia's mistakes to secure Super 8 spotT20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka said Sri Lanka knew Australia were 20 runs short, planned a calm 12-over approach and executed perfectly to seal an eight-wicket win and Super 8 spot.

How can Australia seal Super 8 spot after shock Sri Lanka defeat?T20 World Cup 2026: Australia's Super 8 hopes hang by a thread after Sri Lanka's win, with Mitchell Marsh admitting they now need "the luck of the Irish" to stay alive.

How 2 ex-India coaches planned Australia's downfall in T20 World CupSri Lanka vs Australia: Co-hosts Sri Lanka qualified for the Super 8s by beating Australia in Pallekele. After the game, head coach Sanath Jayasuriya explained how two Indian coaches helped him shape this Sri Lankan side.

Matchday Preview: New Zealand hunt Super 8 spot, AFG stare at knockoutICC T20 World Cup: It is time for Matchday 11 in the T20 World Cup 2026. A couple of big games will decide the fate of the two very important teams in Group B and D.

Kohli would never give up: Dinesh Karthik rips into Babar Azam, ends GOAT debateDinesh Karthik reignited the Kohli vs Babar debate after Pakistan's loss, calling Babar's shot "submission" and saying Virat Kohli would never give up under pressure.

Match vs AUS one of Sri Lanka's best performances in recent past: ShanakaT20 World Cup: Sri Lanka beat Australia in the T20 World Cup to qualify for the Super 8s. After the win, captain Dasun Shanaka called the game one of Sri Lanka's finest in the recent past.

Nissanka's Pallekele century floors Australia, ex-champs stare at early exitT20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka's blazing century powered Sri Lanka to an eight-wicket win over Australia, sealing a Super 8 berth and ending a three-year wait for victory over the Aussies in the shortest format.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi skips Class 10 Board exams, joins RR for IPL 2026India's teenage cricket sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi will not appear for his Class 10 board exams this year. His focus remains on IPL 2026 preparations after a stellar U19 World Cup performance.

Suryakumar Yadav, Kuldeep Yadav patch up after on-ground spat in Colombo: WatchT20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav and Kuldeep Yadav made up after their on-field spat during India's win over Pakistan, sharing a light-hearted video to show there is no rift in the camp.

India had enough runs to enforce follow-on vs Pakistan: R AshwinIND vs PAK: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin joked that India could have followed-on Pakistan in Colombo on Sunday. Ashwin's comments come after the India vs Pakistan match, where the Suryakumar Yadav side beat Pakistan by 61 runs.

England outlast resilient Italy to book Super 8 spot with win by 24 runs in KolkataENG vs ITA, T20 World Cup: England held their nerve to defeat spirited Italy by 24 runs at Eden Gardens, booking their Super 8 berth despite Ben Manenti's breathtaking 60, threatening a major upset in Kolkata.

Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi faces axe after humiliating defeat against India: ReportIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: It seems like the Pakistan management has had enough of Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi following their poor displays against India with the management reportedly set to drop the star duo in their upcoming game against Namibia.

Rashid Khan scripts history, becomes first bowler to take 700 T20 wicketsAfghanistan captain Rashid Khan became the first cricketer to claim 700 wickets in T20 cricket. His record-breaking feat helped Afghanistan secure a five-wicket win over UAE in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 group stage.

Abhishek Sharma will bounce back: Harbhajan backs batter after duck vs PAKT20 World Cup: Harbhajan Singh backed Abhishek Sharma to bounce back after two ducks in the T20 World Cup, including a four-ball duck vs Pakistan. The former spinner said Abhishek will deliver when India need him most.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
